com.facebook.buck.core.graph.transformation

Class DefaultGraphTransformationEngine<ComputeKey,ComputeResult>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.facebook.buck.core.graph.transformation.DefaultGraphTransformationEngine<ComputeKey,ComputeResult>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    GraphTransformationEngine<ComputeKey,ComputeResult>

    public final class DefaultGraphTransformationEngine<ComputeKey,ComputeResult>
extends Object
implements GraphTransformationEngine<ComputeKey,ComputeResult>
    Transformation engine that transforms supplied ComputeKey into ComputeResult via GraphTransformer. This engine is able to asynchronously run graph based computation, reusing results when possible. Note that the computation dependency graph must be an acyclic graph.

    This engine is able to deal with dependencies in the computation graph by having Transformer request dependent results of other transformations through GraphTransformer.discoverDeps(Object). The engine guarantees that all dependencies are completed before performing the transformation.

    Transformations also should never block waiting for each other in any manner. If required to wait, the transformation must declare it through GraphTransformer.discoverDeps(Object)

    The transformation is incremental, so cached portions of the transformation will be used whenever possible based on ComputeKey.equals(). Therefore, ComputeKey should be immutable, and have deterministic equals. For future perspective, we want to have ComputeKey be serializable, so that we can eventually send keys to be computed remotely.

    A custom cache can be supplied to the engine to cache the computation as desired.

    Transformations will be applied asynchronously, so independent transformations can be executed in parallel. It is therefore important that transformations are thread safe.

    By using all callback based operations and queue based operations, this engine will also reduce stack usage, eliminating stack overflow for large graph computations, provided that the GraphTransformer itself does not stack overflow within its GraphTransformer.discoverDeps(Object) and GraphTransformer.transform(Object, TransformationEnvironment) methods.

        Constructs a DefaultGraphTransformationEngine with a default cache that uses the ComputeKey for reusability.
        Parameters:
        transformer - the transformer
        estimatedNumOps - the estimated number of operations this engine will execute given a computation to reserve the size of its computation index
        executor - the custom DepsAwareExecutor the engine uses to execute tasks
